properties.name: 1100 Bergen St. Community Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc    A land trust under the stewardship the local Home Owners Association, this beautiful garden opened in 1982 with Plant-A-Lot assistance from CENYC. Activities include an autumn back-to-school party, children\'s workshops and a large vegetable garden.

properties.name: All People's Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc   A land trust garden created in 1978 by VISTA volunteer Olean For to unite her block against drug trafficking. Newly renovated in 2004 with Plant-a-Lot assistance. A meeting ground for neighbors with special events utilizing a stage and gazebo.

properties.name: Amboy Neighborhood Center Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc    Since 1984, this Plant-a-Lot assisted community garden and playground has provided play space for neighborhood children for over 20 years. Ornamental trees and shrubs, lawn, vegetable and flower beds. Benches, picnic tables, BBQ area.

properties.name: Creative Little Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc  A Plant - A -Lot assisted community garden begun in 1978 and refurbished in 2004, with an elegant winding gravel path, rock garden, seating area and art projects. An example of how community spirit and effort can change the environment.

properties.name: Hull Street Community Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc   Wrought iron fencing encloses this beautiful community garden. Over 20 vegetable, herb and flower beds provide seasonal produce for neighborhood residents. Lawn, Pond and underground irrigation.

properties.name: Jacquline Denise Davis Community Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc   Vegetable and flower beds for communal gardening. Mature evergreen and deciduous trees and shrubs. A Housing Open Space Initiative site opened in 1999 with support from CENYC\'s Plant-A-Lot project and the Trust for Public Land.

properties.name: Joseph Cali-Vincent Artuso Park
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc Lots for Tots with mature trees and shrubs, pre - school and school age play equipment for children of adjacent child care facility.

properties.name: Kenton Hall Community Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc   This garden opened in 1981 with funding from the Plant-A-Lot project of CENYC. Mature evergreen and deciduous trees and shrubs. Colorful floral display in summer. Wrought iron fencing. Vegetables, herbs, and fruit trees.

properties.name: Miracle Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc  Miracle Garden was begun in 1983. It is a beautiful garden with a variety of plantings. The rear area of the garden obscured from the street is calm and cool on a hot summer day. For access to the garden inquire next door at Mama\'s Restaurant.

properties.name: P.S. 4K Paradise Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc   The garden, a green oasis in urban East NY, boasts fruit trees, shrubs, a gazebo, picnic area, fish pond and 50 raised beds.

properties.name: PS 76 Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc   A new garden for the use of elementary school students and neighboring community. It replaces the Garden of Love (on another site) that was bulldozed by the city. CENYC\'s Plant-a-Lot provided new picnic tables, benches arbor, stone walls and plants.

properties.name: Parque de Tranquilidad
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc  With winding brick paths and numerous isolated areas, the garden displays day lilies, lacecap hydrangeas, antique roses, rose of sharon.

properties.name: Placita Infantil
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc  Placita Infantil Lots for Tots opened in 1991 is operated by Nuestros Ninos Daycare. Used daily by Daycare students and open a few hours each evening and weekends to children in the community. Garden includes evergreen trees and shrubs.

properties.name: Sunshine Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc    This garden is a peaceful sanctuary with flowers, vegetables. The group has annual barbeques and summer workshops for children. The front has a star shaped children\'s bed & pint sized table. There is a swinging bench-rose arbor in the middle.

properties.name: Wyckoff-Bond Garden
properties.description: Posted by Cenyc  This flower garden across the street from a NYC housing project really brightens things up. People enjoy walking by and wonder that such beauty exists in this part of Brooklyn.
